lead_paragraph: After players learned their salaries would be cut by about 38 percent to keep the National Women’s Hockey League afloat, they called for more transparency from the league office.

headline.print_headline: Big Pay Cuts Jolt a Women’s League and Leave Its Future Uncertain
headline.main: Pay Cuts Jolt Women’s Pro League and Leave Its Future Uncertain

snippet: After players learned their salaries would be cut by about 38 percent to keep the National Women’s Hockey League afloat, they called for more transparency from the league office....
abstract: National Women’s Hockey League players, surprised by recently announced pay cut, ask league for more transparency regarding its financial situation; drop in attendance forces move by fledgling league, which was founded in 2015 and has no collective bargaining agreement with its players.
